column4: is there any command to change the gdm, or any command to install any utility where i can change the gdm?
what exactly do you want to change?
i want to change the gdm theme
under Administration, there is an option called "Login Window
i know this , i want to add more gdm option
under the "Local" tab, you can change the theme.
i know this, i want to add more option?
What do you mean?
in System>Administration>Log in window >local tab only eight option there ,want to add more
click on the "Add" button.
clicking the add button got a window ,but what would i add?
how would i get that theme to add new ?
Well, you have to download a new theme if you want to add one. Just add the file you downloaded.
It will most likely be a .tar.gz file.
Yes, that's what i looking for. is there any command or any utility to avoid manually download?
No. If you want a theme that isn't already included, you'll have to get it yourself. Check gnome-look.org for gdm themes.
i know about this. but there is a command like "apt-get install gnome-splashscreen" for splashscreen,i am looking for this type of option
A splashscreen is very different than a GDM theme.
is it possible to make my own gdm,?
Yes.
how ,can you give any easy reference?
